title.narrative: Strengthening Health Outcomes through the Private Sector (SHOPS)

description.narrative: (Ghana): USAID will use fiscal year 2018 funds to strengthen the capacity of the private sector, build the capacity of pharmaceutical manufacturers and encourage local manufacturing of neonatal life-saving commodities, such as chlorhexidine digluconate 7.1% for cord care in newborns in partnership with Ghana Health Service (GHS) and other relevant stakeholders. The activity will also collaborate with GHS and the Ghana Registered Midwives Association to train private sector midwives nationwide on the revised protocol for family planning. By facilitating Development Credit Authority-supported guarantee loans with Fidelity Bank and Ecobank to the Christian Health Association of Ghana and private facilities, USAID will increase access to finance for private providers to deliver maternal and child health, and family planning services to underserved communities. USAID assistance will advance Ghana's efforts to reduce its dependency foreign aid through strengthened private sector investments... .
